value.title: Understanding Contextual AI In The Modern Business World
value.excerpt: Exploring emerging technologies and those with features that can adapt will help meet this modern world head-on.

value.title: Face ID for Apple Macs to arrive in a “couple of years”: Gurman
value.excerpt: Apple might just be planning on bringing Face ID system to the Mac. Known Bloomberg journalist Mark Gurman believes that Face ID will be available in Macs within a “couple of years.” Gurman shared this news on the latest edition of his Power On newsletter.

value.title: Galaxy S10 5G update reportedly breaks face recognition
value.excerpt: Samsung has been making good in its promise to roll out Android updates more regularly, even if a bit belatedly. Part of that involves improving its process for integrating and testing those

value.title: GM’s self-driving skills take a wrong turn
value.excerpt: General Motors’ (GM.N) latest journey in autonomous driving has taken it to the courthouse. Late on Friday, the $80 billion carmaker filed a suit accusing Ford Motor (F.N) of trademark infringement after the latter renamed its new driver-assist technology BlueCruise.

value.title: Commercial AI-powered NLP chatbot by CIMB now available to Malaysian SMEs
value.excerpt: NLP, a sub-set of AI, has applications in many customer service-heavy sectors. Should SMEs consider using this technology?

value.title: What's Wrong with IBM Watson & Is Narrow AI Helpful in Healthcare?
value.excerpt: IBM poured millions of dollars to revolutionise healthcare, but the experiment turned out to be far more difficult and time-consuming than expected.

value.title: With post-pandemic AI, we’ve now stepped into the Age of Acceleration
value.excerpt: AI is entering take-off mode just as we exit an economic downturn caused by the pandemic. Get ready for a productivity boom.

value.title: Data Centers in an AI and ML driven future

value.title: This AI can spot sunken ships from the damn sky
value.excerpt: Researcher Leila Character taught a computer how to recognize shipwrecks on the ocean floor from scans taken by aircraft and ships on the surface.

value.title: Google-linked Waymo lobbies UK on driverless car rules
value.excerpt: Waymo, Google’s driverless-car sister company, has warned against the UK imposing strict rules for self-driving vehicles in one of its first interventions in Britain. The company has submitted comments to a Law Commission consultation about how laws for driverless cars should be written,

value.title: Aurora’s SPAC merger comes amid self-driving car delays
value.excerpt: Self-driving car startup Aurora is ready to go public in a reverse merger with SPAC Reinvent Technology Partners Y.

value.title: Deadline 2024: Why you only have 3 years left to adopt AI
value.excerpt: If your company has yet to embrace AI, you’re in a race against the clock. And by my calculations, you have just three years left.

value.title: Why AI Is Pushing Marketing Professionals To Reinvent Themselves
value.excerpt: A Five-Stage Road Map to Implementing Artificial Intelligence in Marketing," shares insight on how marketers must upskill to address the changing marketing landscape.

value.title: China Roundup: Kai-Fu Lee’s first Europe bet, WeRide buys a truck startup
value.excerpt: Hello and welcome back to TechCrunch’s China Roundup, a digest of recent events shaping the Chinese tech landscape and what they mean to people in the rest of the world. Despite the geopolitical headwinds for foreign tech firms to enter China,

value.title: AI Weekly: OpenAI’s pivot from robotics acknowledges the power of simulation
value.excerpt: OpenAI has shuttered its robotics research team. But that doesn't mean the firm won't create a system capable of controlling a machine.

value.title: Researchers demonstrate that malware can be hidden inside AI models
value.excerpt: The three embedded 36.9MiB of malware into a 178MiB AlexNet model without significantly altering the function of the model itself. The malware-embedded model classified images with near-identical accuracy,

value.title: Dazzled by the Sun, NASA taps AI to give its solar telescope an eye-test
value.excerpt: Staring at the Sun is ill-advised if you want to keep your eyesight, but NASA’s solar telescopes have some sneaky ways to avoid burn-out as the space agency gleans vital information about

value.title: AI can add bias to hiring practices: One company found another way
value.excerpt: After anglicizing his name, the founder of Knockri got a job. So he created a solution to remove bias from artificial intelligence in hiring.

value.title: Xilinx Expands Vitis AI Development Platform To Support Latest Versal ACAP And Kria SOM Devices
value.excerpt: Since its unveiling, the Vitis AI development environment has evolved and expanded in scope to incorporate more tools, example designs, libraries and models designed to best leverage Xilinx’s varied array of compute devices,

value.title: AI Tool Shows How Machine Learning Could Make Video Editing More Efficient
value.excerpt: A new AI tool is attempting to harness some of the recent advancements made in machine learning’s video production capacities behind a sleek user interface. Patrick Kulp is an emerging tech reporter at Adweek.

value.title: Want your unemployment benefits? You may have to submit to facial recognition first
value.excerpt: After being let go from his job as a software quality-assurance engineer in April, Eric Watkins said he filed for unemployment benefits in Colorado. But he hasn't received a penny of the $6,490 he said he was eligible to receive and he's not sure when he will.

value.title: 25 States Are Forcing Face Recognition on People Filing for Unemployment
value.excerpt: State labor departments claim that they're using face recognition identity verification to prevent fraud, but you might want to check out the privacy policy.

value.title: Alphabet tackles industrial robot software market
value.excerpt: Google 's parent company Alphabet has launched a new company called Intrinsic to make industrial robots easier to program. Originally a project within Google's X research group, Intrinsic has graduated as an independent company within Alphabet.

value.title: Tesla Full Self-Driving explained: Its capabilities, cost and puzzling over-promise
value.excerpt: Perhaps the most overly optimistic technology in all of the auto industry is Tesla's Full Self-Driving package. No car for sale to the general public can do what that name says. Here's what it really does and how to get it on your Tesla.

value.title: Is Artificial Intelligence The New Logistics Technology For Organ Transportation?
value.excerpt: Twenty people die each day because they do not receive their lifesaving organs on time. Can AI and drones make a real change?
